01-01.title: First Rose Bowl Game
01-01.description: On January 1, 1902, the first Rose Bowl game was played, with Michigan defeating Stanford 49-0. The game was so lopsided that it was discontinued until 1916.

01-01.title: Tokyo's New Year Ekiden Road Relay
01-01.description: Every January 1, Japan hosts the New Year Ekiden, a long-distance road relay race featuring corporate teams, broadcast nationwide and attracting millions of viewers.

01-04.title: First Modern Olympics Announced
01-04.description: On January 4, 1894, Pierre de Coubertin proposed the revival of the Olympic Games, leading to the formation of the International Olympic Committee and the first modern Olympics in 1896.

01-11.title: First Australian Open Tennis Championship
01-11.description: On January 11, 1905, the first Australian Open tennis championship began in Melbourne, originally called the Australasian Championships.

01-15.title: Super Bowl I
01-15.description: On January 15, 1967, the first Super Bowl was played between the Green Bay Packers and Kansas City Chiefs, with the Packers winning 35-10 at the Los Angeles Memorial Coliseum.

01-20.title: First Winter X Games
01-20.description: On January 20, 1997, the first Winter X Games began in Big Bear Lake, California, featuring extreme winter sports like snowboarding, skiing, and snowmobiling.

01-26.title: Australian Open Final Weekend
01-26.description: Late January typically features the Australian Open tennis finals, with January 26, 2020 seeing Novak Djokovic win his 8th Australian Open title.

01-28.title: Super Bowl XXII - Doug Williams Makes History
01-28.description: On January 28, 1988, Doug Williams became the first Black quarterback to start and win a Super Bowl, leading Washington to victory in Super Bowl XXII.

01-31.title: Super Bowl XXXI - Packers Return to Glory
01-31.description: On January 31, 1997, the Green Bay Packers won their first Super Bowl in 29 years, defeating the New England Patriots 35-21 in Super Bowl XXXI.

02-01.title: Super Bowl XXXVI - Patriots Begin Dynasty
02-01.description: On February 1, 2002, the New England Patriots won their first Super Bowl, defeating the St. Louis Rams 20-17 in Super Bowl XXXVI, beginning the Brady-Belichick dynasty.

02-02.title: First Winter Olympics Opening Ceremony
02-02.description: On February 2, 1924, the first Winter Olympic Games opened in Chamonix, France, originally called 'International Winter Sports Week' before being retroactively designated as the first Winter Olympics.

02-03.title: Super Bowl XLVII - The Harbaugh Bowl
02-03.description: On February 3, 2013, Super Bowl XLVII featured brothers John and Jim Harbaugh coaching against each other, with John's Baltimore Ravens defeating Jim's San Francisco 49ers.

02-04.title: First African American NHL Player
02-04.description: On February 4, 1958, Willie O'Ree became the first Black player in the National Hockey League, debuting for the Boston Bruins against the Montreal Canadiens.

02-05.title: First Winter Olympics Conclude in Chamonix
02-05.description: On February 5, 1924, the first Winter Olympic Games, held in Chamonix, France, officially came to a close.

02-05.title: Pittsburgh Steelers Win Super Bowl XL
02-05.description: On February 5, 2006, the Pittsburgh Steelers defeated the Seattle Seahawks 21-10 in Super Bowl XL, becoming the first franchise to win five Super Bowl titles.

02-05.title: New York Giants Upset New England Patriots in Super Bowl XLII
02-05.description: On February 5, 2012, the New York Giants beat the New England Patriots 21-17 in Super Bowl XLVI, handing quarterback Tom Brady and the Patriots a dramatic last-minute defeat.

02-07.title: Super Bowl XLI - First Black Head Coach Wins
02-07.description: On February 7, 2007, Tony Dungy became the first Black head coach to win a Super Bowl as his Indianapolis Colts defeated the Chicago Bears in Super Bowl XLI.

02-08.title: First NHL All-Star Game
02-08.description: On February 8, 1947, the first NHL All-Star Game was played, with the All-Stars defeating the Toronto Maple Leafs 4-3 to raise money for the newly created NHL Pension Society.

02-09.title: Satchel Paige Nominated to Baseball Hall of Fame
02-09.description: On February 9, 1971, legendary pitcher Satchel Paige was nominated to the Baseball Hall of Fame, becoming one of the first players from the Negro Leagues to be so honored.

02-09.title: XIX Winter Olympics Open in Salt Lake City
02-09.description: On February 9, 2002, the XIX Winter Olympic Games officially opened in Salt Lake City, Utah, bringing athletes from 77 nations to compete in 78 events.

02-12.title: NBA All-Star Game First Held
02-12.description: On February 12, 1951, the first NBA All-Star Game was played at Boston Garden, with the East defeating the West 111-94.

02-14.title: Miracle on Ice
02-14.description: On February 14, 1980, the U.S. Olympic hockey team defeated Czechoslovakia 7-3 in the opening round of the Lake Placid Olympics, setting up their eventual 'Miracle on Ice' victory over the Soviet Union.

02-15.title: NBA's First Slam Dunk Contest
02-15.description: On February 15, 1976, the NBA held its first Slam Dunk Contest as part of the ABA All-Star Game, with Julius 'Dr. J' Erving winning the inaugural competition.

02-17.title: NBA's First Three-Point Shootout
02-17.description: On February 17, 1986, the NBA held its first Three-Point Shootout during All-Star Weekend, with Larry Bird winning the inaugural competition.

02-18.title: Tonya Harding-Nancy Kerrigan Incident Investigation
02-18.description: On February 18, 1994, the FBI released findings from their investigation into the attack on Nancy Kerrigan, leading to charges against Tonya Harding's ex-husband and bodyguard.

02-22.title: Miracle on Ice
02-22.description: On February 22, 1980, the United States ice hockey team defeated the Soviet Union 4-3 in the 'Miracle on Ice' at the Lake Placid Winter Olympics, one of the greatest upsets in sports history.

02-24.title: Muhammad Ali Wins Heavyweight Title First Time
02-24.description: On February 24, 1964, a 22-year-old Cassius Clay (later Muhammad Ali) defeated Sonny Liston to become the World Heavyweight Boxing Champion for the first time.

02-25.title: NASCAR's First Daytona 500
02-25.description: On February 25, 1959, the first Daytona 500 was held at Daytona International Speedway, with Lee Petty winning in a photo finish after three days of reviewing footage.

02-27.title: Winter Olympics Closing Ceremonies
02-27.description: Late February often marks the closing ceremonies of Winter Olympic Games, with February 27, 2010 seeing the Vancouver Winter Olympics conclude.

03-01.title: First Organized Baseball Game
03-01.description: On March 1, 1872, the first organized baseball game was played in San Francisco, helping to spread the sport's popularity on the West Coast.

03-06.title: First International Cricket Match
03-06.description: On March 6, 1844, the first official international cricket match was played between the United States and Canada at the St George's Cricket Club in New York.

03-08.title: First Women's World Cup Announced
03-08.description: On March 8, 1991, FIFA announced the first Women's World Cup, which would be held later that year in China, won by the United States.

03-12.title: NCAA Tournament Selection Sunday
03-12.description: Mid-March features Selection Sunday for the NCAA Men's Basketball Tournament, with March 12, 2023 marking the selection of the 68-team field for March Madness.

03-15.title: NCAA Tournament First Round Begins
03-15.description: Mid-March marks the beginning of the NCAA Basketball Tournament's first round, with March 15 typically being the first full day of games in the 'March Madness' tournament.

03-17.title: St. Patrick's Day Sports Traditions
03-17.description: March 17 sees numerous sports traditions, including the dyeing of the Chicago River green, special Gaelic football and hurling matches in Ireland, and green uniforms in various sports.

03-20.title: First Official Baseball Game
03-20.description: On March 20, 1888, the first official baseball game was played in Japan, marking the beginning of baseball's popularity in the country.

03-22.title: First NBA Game
03-22.description: On March 22, 1946, the first Basketball Association of America (BAA) game was played, with the New York Knicks defeating the Toronto Huskies 68-66. The BAA would later become the NBA.

03-25.title: First Modern Olympics Revival Announced
03-25.description: On March 25, 1896, the first modern Olympic Games concluded in Athens, Greece, reviving the ancient tradition after nearly 1,500 years.

03-28.title: First Night Baseball Game
03-28.description: On March 28, 1936, the first night baseball game in the major leagues was played between the Cincinnati Reds and Philadelphia Phillies at Crosley Field.

03-30.title: First Masters Golf Tournament
03-30.description: On March 30, 1934, the first Masters Tournament began at Augusta National Golf Club, with Horton Smith winning the inaugural event.

03-31.title: Opening Day of Major League Baseball
03-31.description: Late March or early April marks Opening Day for Major League Baseball, with March 31 being a common date for season openers, beginning the 162-game regular season.

04-01.title: NHL players begin first strike in 75-year history; 10
04-01.description: On April 1, 1992, NHL players begin first strike in 75-year history; 10 day action earns large playoff bonus increase, more control over licensing of their likenesses and changes to free agency system

04-02.title: Longest strike in American major league sports history
04-02.description: On April 2, 1995, Longest strike in American major league sports history (232 days) ends as MLB owners accept players’ offer to return to work without a contract; MLB is the first major pro sports league to lose an entire postseason due to a labor dispute

04-03.title: Bobby Fischer is stripped of the world chess title for
04-03.description: On April 3, 1975, Bobby Fischer is stripped of the world chess title for refusing to defend it, and the title is awarded to Russian Anatoly Karpov

04-04.title: Hank Aaron ties Babe Ruth's home run record by hitting
04-04.description: On April 4, 1974, Hank Aaron ties Babe Ruth's home run record by hitting his 714th in Cincinnati against Jack Billingham

04-05.title: Kareem Abdul-Jabbar breaks Wilt Chamberlain's all-time
04-05.description: On April 5, 1984, Kareem Abdul-Jabbar breaks Wilt Chamberlain's all-time career scoring record of 31,419 points

04-06.title: First modern Summer Olympic Games open in Athens
04-06.description: On April 6, 1896, First modern Summer Olympic Games open in Athens, Greece; American athlete James Connolly becomes the first modern Olympic champion when he wins the triple jump (then 2 hops and a jump); later places 3rd in long jump and 2nd in high jump

04-06.title: Washington Capitals left wing Alex Ovechkin becomes
04-06.description: On April 6, 2025, Washington Capitals left wing Alex Ovechkin becomes the greatest scorer in NHL history passing Wayne Gretzky with his 895th career goal in a 4-1 loss to the NY Islanders at UBS Arena in Elmont, New York

04-07.title: South African cricket captain Hansie Cronje is charged
04-07.description: On April 7, 2000, South African cricket captain Hansie Cronje is charged by Delhi police with fixing One Day International matches against India

04-08.title: Hammerin' Hank Aaron hits his 715th home run off LA
04-08.description: On April 8, 1974, Hammerin' Hank Aaron hits his 715th home run off LA Dodger Al Downing in Atlanta, breaking Babe Ruth's record

04-09.title: 13th NBA Championship: Boston Celtics sweep
04-09.description: On April 9, 1959, 13th NBA Championship: Boston Celtics sweep Minneapolis Lakers in 4 games, first of Boston Celtics' record 8 straight titles

04-10.title: 58:50) in Athens, running the last lap accompanied by
04-10.description: On April 10, 1896, Spyridon Louis of Greece wins the inaugural Olympic marathon (2:58:50) in Athens, running the last lap accompanied by Constantine I

04-11.title: Politician Henry Clay (21) weds Lucretia Hart in
04-11.description: On April 11, 1799, Politician Henry Clay (21) weds Lucretia Hart in Lexington, Kentucky

04-11.title: Industrialist Henry Ford (24) weds Clara Jane Bryant
04-11.description: On April 11, 1888, Industrialist Henry Ford (24) weds Clara Jane Bryant (22) in Greenfield Township, Michigan

04-11.title: Actress Mae West (17) weds fellow vaudevillian Frank
04-11.description: On April 11, 1911, Actress Mae West (17) weds fellow vaudevillian Frank Wallace (21) in Milwaukee, Wisconsin

04-12.title: US Olympic Committee endorses a boycott of the Moscow
04-12.description: On April 12, 1980, US Olympic Committee endorses a boycott of the Moscow summer Olympics

04-13.title: Stan Musial scores his 1
04-13.description: On April 13, 1962, Stan Musial scores his 1,869th run, setting a new National League record

04-14.title: 66th US Masters Tournament: Tiger Woods becomes the
04-14.description: On April 14, 2002, 66th US Masters Tournament: Tiger Woods becomes the third player to claim back-to-back Masters, three strokes ahead of Retief Goosen of South Africa

04-15.title: 1st Modern Summer Olympic Games close at Panathenaic
04-15.description: On April 15, 1896, 1st Modern Summer Olympic Games close at Panathenaic Stadium in Athens, Greece; USA wins gold medal count with 11 and Greece the total medal count with 46

04-15.title: Jackie Robinson becomes the first African American to
04-15.description: On April 15, 1947, Jackie Robinson becomes the first African American to play in Major League Baseball for the Brooklyn Dodgers

04-15.title: Hillsborough disaster: 96 people are crushed to death
04-15.description: On April 15, 1989, Hillsborough disaster: 96 people are crushed to death and 766 are injured at Hillsborough Football Stadium in Sheffield, England, during an FA Cup semi-final between Liverpool and Nottingham Forest

04-16.title: Cleveland Indians become the first MLB team to
04-16.description: On April 16, 1929, Cleveland Indians become the first MLB team to permanently feature numbers on the backs of uniforms; numbers correspond to the position in the batting order

04-17.title: Police Halt Boxing Match 1860 Champion of England Tom
04-17.description: On April 17, 1860, Police Halt Boxing Match 1860 Champion of England Tom Sayers and American John Heenan fight a brutal 2-hour, 27-minute draw that ends only after police stop the fight near Farnborough in England, acknowledged as the first world title bout

04-17.title: Trailing 12-1, the Philadelphia Phillies beat the
04-17.description: On April 17, 1976, Trailing 12-1, the Philadelphia Phillies beat the Chicago Cubs 18-16 in 10 innings at Wrigley Field; Mike Schmidt hits four consecutive home runs in the greatest comeback in NL history

04-18.title: First run of 2,000 guineas horse race at Newmarket,
04-18.description: On April 18, 1809, First run of 2,000 guineas horse race at Newmarket, England

04-19.title: 1st Boston Marathon (B.A.A. Road Race)
04-19.description: On April 19, 1897, 1st Boston Marathon (B.A.A. Road Race), won by John J. McDermott in 2:55:10; the world's oldest annual marathon inspired by success of the first marathon at the 1896 Summer Olympics

04-20.title: Danica Patrick driving for Andretti Green Racing wins
04-20.description: On April 20, 2008, Danica Patrick driving for Andretti Green Racing wins the Indy Japan 300 at Twin Ring Motegi; first female driver in history to win an IndyCar Series race

04-21.title: Ty Cobb makes his professional debut for the Augusta
04-21.description: On April 21, 1904, Ty Cobb makes his professional debut for the Augusta Tourists in the South Atlantic League

04-22.title: NY Highlanders (Yankees) play their first MLB game
04-22.description: On April 22, 1903, NY Highlanders (Yankees) play their first MLB game, losing 3-1 before 11,950 spectators against the Washington Senators at American League Park

04-23.title: West Indian cricketer Chris Gayle smashes the fastest
04-23.description: On April 23, 2013, West Indian cricketer Chris Gayle smashes the fastest century in history in just 30 balls

04-24.title: Bill Shoemaker wins his 8
04-24.description: On April 24, 1981, Bill Shoemaker wins his 8,000th horse race, 2,000 more than any other jockey

04-25.title: Chuck Cooper becomes the 1st African American to be
04-25.description: On April 25, 1950, Chuck Cooper becomes the 1st African American to be drafted into the NBA (for Boston Celtics)

04-26.title: A tradition begins with the first organ at a baseball
04-26.description: On April 26, 1941, A tradition begins with the first organ at a baseball stadium (Chicago Cubs)

04-27.title: Undefeated world heavyweight boxing champion Rocky
04-27.description: On April 27, 1956, Undefeated world heavyweight boxing champion Rocky Marciano retires from the ring

04-28.title: World's First Motor Race 1887 "Europe's first motoring
04-28.description: On April 28, 1887, World's First Motor Race 1887 "Europe's first motoring competition" is 'won' by The Marquis de Dion on a steam-powered quadricycle built by French toymaker and engineer Georges Bouton; French newspaper Le Velocipede organized the 'test', and Bouton was the only participant

04-28.title: Andre Agassi recaptures the world #1 ranking to become
04-28.description: On April 28, 2003, Andre Agassi recaptures the world #1 ranking to become the oldest top-ranked male in the history of the ATP rankings at 33 years and 13 days

04-29.title: First official International Weightlifting Federation
04-29.description: On April 29, 1922, First official International Weightlifting Federation Championship is held in Tallinn, Estonia

04-30.title: Manchester City defeats Manchester United 1-0 in what
04-30.description: On April 30, 2012, Manchester City defeats Manchester United 1-0 in what is claimed to be the biggest match in English Premier League history

05-01.title: Bob Rogers is acknowledged as the first American pro
05-01.description: On May 1, 1883, Bob Rogers is acknowledged as the first American pro sports trainer when he is hired by the NY Athletic Club

05-02.title: Leicester City wins the English Premier League title
05-02.description: On May 2, 2016, Leicester City wins the English Premier League title after starting the season at 5,000-1 odds

05-03.title: World Snooker Championship
05-03.description: On May 3, 1999, World Snooker Championship, Crucible Theatre, Sheffield: Stephen Hendry of Scotland defeats Welshman Mark Williams 18-11 for a record seventh world crown

05-04.title: Cincinnati Red Stockings play their first official
05-04.description: On May 4, 1869, Cincinnati Red Stockings play their first official baseball game, defeating the Great Western Base Ball Club 45-9

05-05.title: Cy Young pitches the first perfect game in "modern"
05-05.description: On May 5, 1904, Cy Young pitches the first perfect game in "modern" baseball as the Boston Americans beat Philadelphia Athletics, 3-0

05-05.title: Milwaukee Bucks sign #1 NBA Draft pick
05-05.description: On May 5, 1969, Milwaukee Bucks sign #1 NBA Draft pick, star UCLA center Lew Alcindor ( Kareem Abdul-Jabbar )

05-06.title: 59.4 at Iffley Road Track in Oxford
05-06.description: On May 6, 1954, English athlete Roger Bannister becomes the first to run a sub-4-minute mile, recording 3:59.4 at Iffley Road Track in Oxford

05-07.title: Champion Puerto Rican jockey Ángel Cordero Jr. retires
05-07.description: On May 7, 1992, Champion Puerto Rican jockey Ángel Cordero Jr. retires after winning 7,057 thoroughbred horse races

05-08.title: The Soviet Union announces it will not participate in
05-08.description: On May 8, 1984, The Soviet Union announces it will not participate in Los Angeles Summer Olympics in retaliation for the American boycott of the 1980 Moscow Olympics

05-09.title: Accra Sports Stadium Disaster: 129 Ghanaian football
05-09.description: On May 9, 2001, Accra Sports Stadium Disaster: 129 Ghanaian football fans die in a stampede caused by the firing of tear gas by police following a decision by the referee in a crucial match between arch-rivals Accra Hearts of Oak and Kumasi Asante Kotoko

05-10.title: Stanley Cup Final, Boston Garden, Boston, MA: Bobby
05-10.description: On May 10, 1970, Stanley Cup Final, Boston Garden, Boston, MA: Bobby Orr scores a famous OT winner as Boston beats the St. Louis Blues 4-3 for a 4-0 series sweep; Bruins win their first title since 1941

05-11.title: Henri Desgrange establishes world's 1st bicycle world
05-11.description: On May 11, 1893, Henri Desgrange establishes world's 1st bicycle world record, travelling 35.325 km (21.95 miles) an hour

05-12.title: Crouching start first used in track and field by
05-12.description: On May 12, 1888, Crouching start first used in track and field by Charles Sherrill of Yale

05-13.title: First-ever race of the Formula 1 World Drivers'
05-13.description: On May 13, 1950, First-ever race of the Formula 1 World Drivers' Championship is run at Silverstone, England, and won by Giuseppe Farina of Italy in an Alfa Romeo

05-14.title: NY Yankee Mickey Mantle hits career HR #500 off
05-14.description: On May 14, 1967, NY Yankee Mickey Mantle hits career HR #500 off Baltimore Orioles' Stu Miller

05-15.title: First baseball enclosure opens at Union Grounds in
05-15.description: On May 15, 1862, First baseball enclosure opens at Union Grounds in Brooklyn

05-15.title: Jessica Watson at age 16 becomes the youngest person
05-15.description: On May 15, 2010, Jessica Watson at age 16 becomes the youngest person to sail solo, non-stop and unassisted around the world

05-16.title: Marie Antoinette (14) marries future King Louis XVI
05-16.description: On May 16, 1770, Marie Antoinette (14) marries future King Louis XVI (15) of France

05-16.title: Austrian composer Johann Nepomuk Hummel (35) weds
05-16.description: On May 16, 1813, Austrian composer Johann Nepomuk Hummel (35) weds German opera singer Elisabeth Röckel (20) in Vienna, Austria, until his death in 1837

05-16.title: American writer Edgar Allan Poe (26) marries his
05-16.description: On May 16, 1836, American writer Edgar Allan Poe (26) marries his 13-year-old cousin Virginia Clemm

05-17.title: Oliver Lewis aboard Aristides wins in 2:37.75
05-17.description: On May 17, 1875, 1st Kentucky Derby: Oliver Lewis aboard Aristides wins in 2:37.75

05-18.title: Edmonton right wing Jari Kurri sets a record for
05-18.description: On May 18, 1990, Edmonton right wing Jari Kurri sets a record for scoring in a Stanley Cup Finals game with 3 goals and 2 assists in a 7-2 win at Boston Garden

05-19.title: Willy T. Ribbs overcomes numerous mechanical problems
05-19.description: On May 19, 1991, Willy T. Ribbs overcomes numerous mechanical problems in qualifying to become the first African-American driver to make the Indianapolis 500 starting grid

05-20.title: Second modern Summer Olympics opens in Paris and
05-20.description: On May 20, 1900, Second modern Summer Olympics (Games of the II Olympiad) opens in Paris and continues for five months

05-21.title: Federation Internationale de Football Association
05-21.description: On May 21, 1904, Federation Internationale de Football Association (FIFA) forms in Paris

05-22.title: Annika Sörenstam becomes the first woman to play on
05-22.description: On May 22, 2003, Annika Sörenstam becomes the first woman to play on the PGA Tour in 58 years in Fort Worth, Texas

05-23.title: 1st Preakness Stakes: G. Barbee aboard Survivor wins
05-23.description: On May 23, 1873, 1st Preakness Stakes: G. Barbee aboard Survivor wins in 2:43 at Pimlico Race Course, Baltimore, Maryland

05-24.title: First Major League night baseball game
05-24.description: On May 24, 1935, First Major League night baseball game, Reds beat Philadelphia 2-1 in Cincinnati

05-25.title: The Greatest 45 Minutes in Sports History 1935
05-25.description: On May 25, 1935, The Greatest 45 Minutes in Sports History 1935 Legendary American athlete Jesse Owens equals or breaks four world records in 45 minutes at a Big Ten meet at Ferry Field in Ann Arbor, Michigan; remembered as " the greatest 45 minutes ever in sport "

05-26.title: Inaugural 24 Hours of Le Mans endurance race for cars
05-26.description: On May 26, 1923, Inaugural 24 Hours of Le Mans endurance race for cars starts through public roads around Le Mans, France; inaugural winners are André Lagache and René Léonard (France) for Chenard & Walcker

05-27.title: Fiorentina of Italy wins the first European Cup
05-27.description: On May 27, 1961, Fiorentina of Italy wins the first European Cup Winners' Cup against Glasgow Rangers 4-2 in Florence (second leg)

05-28.title: First indoor swimming pool opens in Goodman's Fields
05-28.description: On May 28, 1742, First indoor swimming pool opens in Goodman's Fields, London

05-29.title: US Supreme Court rules that organized baseball is a
05-29.description: On May 29, 1922, US Supreme Court rules that organized baseball is a sport and not a business, thus not subject to antitrust laws

05-30.title: 1st Indianapolis 500: Ray Harroun
05-30.description: On May 30, 1911, 1st Indianapolis 500: Ray Harroun, driving a Marmon Wasp for Nordyke & Marmon Company, comes out of retirement and wins the inaugural event with an average speed of 74.6 mph (120.1 km/h)

05-31.title: Britain's Dr. James Moore wins the first recorded
05-31.description: On May 31, 1868, Britain's Dr. James Moore wins the first recorded bicycle race, a 2 km velocipede race at Parc de Saint-Cloud, Paris

06-01.title: Ridden by outstanding English jockey Fred Archer
06-01.description: On June 1, 1881, Ridden by outstanding English jockey Fred Archer, Iroquois wins the Epsom Derby to become the first American-owned and bred horse to win a European classic race

06-02.title: Future Baseball Hall of Fame slugger Babe Ruth
06-02.description: On June 2, 1935, Future Baseball Hall of Fame slugger Babe Ruth announces his retirement as a player at 40 years of age

06-03.title: W. G. Grace 's last day of Test cricket at age 50
06-03.description: On June 3, 1899, W. G. Grace 's last day of Test cricket at age 50 years and 320 days

06-04.title: 1st Ryder Cup Golf
06-04.description: On June 4, 1927, 1st Ryder Cup Golf, Worcester CC: US beats Great Britain, 9½-2½; Walter Hagen first American captain; Ted Ray first GB skipper

06-05.title: Steve Cauthen wins aboard Slip Anchor at Epsom Downs
06-05.description: On June 5, 1985, Steve Cauthen wins aboard Slip Anchor at Epsom Downs to become the only jockey to win both the Kentucky Derby (1978) and The Derby

06-06.title: British Open Men's Golf
06-06.description: On June 6, 1901, British Open Men's Golf, Muirfield: Scotsman James Braid wins the first of five Open titles by three strokes over Harry Vardon of Jersey

06-06.title: French Open Women's Tennis: 17-year-old German Steffi
06-06.description: On June 6, 1987, French Open Women's Tennis: 17-year-old German Steffi Graf beats World #1 Martina Navratilova 6-4, 4-6, 8-6; Graf's first Grand Slam victory

06-06.title: The PGA Tour, DP World Tour, and LIV Golf League agree
06-06.description: On June 6, 2023, The PGA Tour, DP World Tour, and LIV Golf League agree to unify to create a for-profit entity run by the PGA Tour and funded by Saudi Arabia's Public Investment Fund

06-07.title: Chicago Cubs score 11 runs in the 1st inning of a 19-0
06-07.description: On June 7, 1906, Chicago Cubs score 11 runs in the 1st inning of a 19-0 drubbing of the New York Giants off future Baseball Hall of Famers Christy Mathewson and Joe McGinnity; worst beating in Giants franchise history

06-07.title: French Open Women's Tennis: Chris Evert beats Martina
06-07.description: On June 7, 1986, French Open Women's Tennis: Chris Evert beats Martina Navratilova 2-6, 6-3, 6-3 for her 18th and final Grand Slam title and record 7th French singles crown

06-08.title: MLB legend Mickey Mantle gives his farewell retirement
06-08.description: On June 8, 1969, MLB legend Mickey Mantle gives his farewell retirement speech during "Mickey Mantle Day" at Yankee Stadium as 60,096 fans see #7 retired

06-09.title: 105th Belmont Stakes: Ron Turcotte aboard Secretariat
06-09.description: On June 9, 1973, 105th Belmont Stakes: Ron Turcotte aboard Secretariat wins in 2:24, becoming the first Triple Crown winner in 25 years

06-10.title: American golfer Al Geiberger becomes the first player
06-10.description: On June 10, 1977, American golfer Al Geiberger becomes the first player in history to post a sub-60 score, 59 (−13), in a PGA Tour-sanctioned event during the second round of the Danny Thomas Memphis Classic at Colonial CC in Tennessee

06-11.title: French Open Men's Tennis: Spaniard Rafael Nadal beats
06-11.description: On June 11, 2017, French Open Men's Tennis: Spaniard Rafael Nadal beats Stan Wawrinka of Switzerland 6–2, 6–3, 6–1; becomes first man to win French title 10 times

06-12.title: Worcester Ruby Legs pitcher Lee Richmond throws the
06-12.description: On June 12, 1880, Worcester Ruby Legs pitcher Lee Richmond throws the first perfect game in MLB history in a 1-0 win over the Cleveland Blues at the Agricultural County Fair Grounds in Worcester

06-13.title: Émile Levassor wins the first automobile race in
06-13.description: On June 13, 1895, Émile Levassor wins the first automobile race in history, the Paris-Bordeaux-Paris, taking 48 hours and 48 minutes (1,178 km)

06-14.title: Miami beats St. Petersburg 4-3 in 29 innings
06-14.description: On June 14, 1966, Miami beats St. Petersburg (Florida State League) 4-3 in 29 innings, the longest uninterrupted game in organized baseball

06-15.title: US Open Men's Golf
06-15.description: On June 15, 1980, US Open Men's Golf, Baltusrol GC: Jack Nicklaus sets new tournament scoring record 272 (-8) to win his 4th Open title, 2 strokes ahead of Isao Aoki of Japan

06-16.title: Jim Thorpe makes his pro baseball pitching debut for
06-16.description: On June 16, 1909, Jim Thorpe makes his pro baseball pitching debut for Rocky Mount (ECL) with a 4-2 win, causing him to forfeit his Olympic gold medals

06-17.title: US Open Men's Golf
06-17.description: On June 17, 1962, US Open Men's Golf, Oakmont CC: Jack Nicklaus wins his first major title by 3 strokes in an 18-hole playoff with Arnold Palmer

06-18.title: All Black Jonah Lomu scores the try of the Rugby World
06-18.description: On June 18, 1995, All Black Jonah Lomu scores the try of the Rugby World Cup, running over Mike Catt in New Zealand's 45-29 defeat of England

06-19.title: First officially recognized baseball game - NY Nine
06-19.description: On June 19, 1846, First officially recognized baseball game (played by Cartwright Rules) - NY Nine defeats the NY Knickerbockers 23-1 in Hoboken, New Jersey

06-19.title: Gilbert Gilpatrick aboard Ruthless wins in 3:05
06-19.description: On June 19, 1867, 1st Belmont Stakes: Gilbert Gilpatrick aboard Ruthless wins in 3:05

06-20.title: 1st Rugby World Cup Final
06-20.description: On June 20, 1987, 1st Rugby World Cup Final, Eden Park, Auckland: New Zealand fly-half Grant Fox lands 4 penalties, a conversion and drop goal as the All Blacks beat France 29-9

06-21.title: FIFA World Cup Final
06-21.description: On June 21, 1970, FIFA World Cup Final, Estadio Azteca, Mexico City: Brazil and Pelé become the first team and player to win the World Cup three times, defeating Italy 4-1 in front of 107,412 spectators

06-22.title: Game of lawn tennis is introduced by Welsh Major
06-22.description: On June 22, 1874, Game of lawn tennis is introduced by Welsh Major Walter Clopton Wingfield, who introduces a rubber ball to bounce on grass

06-22.title: Challenger Joe Louis KOs James J. Braddock in the 8th
06-22.description: On June 22, 1937, Challenger Joe Louis KOs James J. Braddock in the 8th round at Chicago's Comiskey Park for the world heavyweight boxing title

06-22.title: John McEnroe 's famous "You cannot be serious" rant in
06-22.description: On June 22, 1981, John McEnroe 's famous "You cannot be serious" rant in first-round win over Tom Gullikson at Wimbledon

06-23.title: The International Olympic Committee is founded at the
06-23.description: On June 23, 1894, The International Olympic Committee is founded at the Sorbonne, Paris, at the initiative of Baron Pierre de Coubertin, selecting Athens to host the first modern games in 1896 [1]

06-23.title: Barry Bonds steals second base against the LA Dodgers
06-23.description: On June 23, 2003, Barry Bonds steals second base against the LA Dodgers, becoming the first player in MLB history to have 500 career home runs and 500 steals

06-23.title: 1st ICC World Test Championship final
06-23.description: On June 23, 2021, 1st ICC World Test Championship final, Southampton: New Zealand dismisses India for meagre 170; completes tricky chase of 139 on 6th day to win inaugural cricket title

06-24.title: 3rd Rugby World Cup
06-24.description: On June 24, 1995, 3rd Rugby World Cup, Ellis Park, Johannesburg: Springboks fly-half Joel Stransky lands the winning drop goal in extra time as South Africa defeats New Zealand 15-12

06-25.title: Martina Navratilova wins her record 100th singles
06-25.description: On June 25, 1991, Martina Navratilova wins her record 100th singles match at Wimbledon, defeating Elna Reinach of South Africa 4-6, 6-2, 6-4 in the first round

06-26.title: America's Cup: Emirates Team New Zealand defeats
06-26.description: On June 26, 2017, America's Cup: Emirates Team New Zealand defeats Oracle Team USA 7-1 in Bermuda, making Peter Burling (26) the youngest helmsman to win the cup

06-27.title: Canadian boxer George Dixon becomes the first Black
06-27.description: On June 27, 1890, Canadian boxer George Dixon becomes the first Black world champion when he stops English bantamweight champion Edwin "Nunc" Wallace in 18 rounds in London

06-27.title: Tony Hawk is the first skateboarder to land a "900" at
06-27.description: On June 27, 1999, Tony Hawk is the first skateboarder to land a "900" (a 2½-revolution aerial spin) at the X Games in San Francisco, California

06-28.title: US Open Women's Golf
06-28.description: On June 28, 1958, US Open Women's Golf, Forest Lake CC: Mickey Wright wins her first of four Open titles by five strokes over Louise Suggs ; she is the first player to win both the Open and LPGA in the same year

06-29.title: Vavá and Pelé each score two goals as Brazil defeats
06-29.description: On June 29, 1958, FIFA World Cup Final, Råsunda Stadium, Stockholm, Sweden: Vavá and Pelé each score two goals as Brazil defeats Sweden 5-2

06-30.title: FIFA World Cup Final
06-30.description: On June 30, 2002, FIFA World Cup Final, International Stadium, Yokohama, Japan: Ronaldo scores twice as Brazil beats Germany 2-0 to win a record 5th title; first World Cup held in Asia

07-01.title: NBA commences a player lockout after no agreement with
07-01.description: On July 1, 1998, NBA commences a player lockout after no agreement with players about salary issues - lasts 204 days with the season shortened by 50 games

07-02.title: American jockey Steve Cauthen wins the Irish Derby on
07-02.description: On July 2, 1989, American jockey Steve Cauthen wins the Irish Derby on Old Vic to become the first rider in history to sweep the world's four major Derbies (Kentucky, Epsom, French, Irish)

07-03.title: Wimbledon Men's Tennis: Sweden's Björn Borg beats Ilie
07-03.description: On July 3, 1976, Wimbledon Men's Tennis: Sweden's Björn Borg beats Ilie Năstase of Romania 6-4, 6-2, 9-7 for the first of five straight Wimbledon titles

07-04.title: Lou Gehrig is the first MLB player to have his number
07-04.description: On July 4, 1939, Lou Gehrig is the first MLB player to have his number (4) retired on his "Appreciation Day" at Yankee Stadium and makes the iconic "luckiest man" speech

07-05.title: Wimbledon Men's Tennis: Roger Federer beats Andy
07-05.description: On July 5, 2009, Wimbledon Men's Tennis: Roger Federer beats Andy Roddick of the US 5-7, 7-6, 7-6, 3-6, 16-14 for a record 15th Grand Slam singles title

07-06.title: MLB Commissioner Ford Frick inaugurates Cy Young Award
07-06.description: On July 6, 1956, MLB Commissioner Ford Frick inaugurates Cy Young Award, to honor baseball's outstanding pitcher of the season

07-06.title: Wimbledon Women's Tennis: Serena Williams beats older
07-06.description: On July 6, 2002, Wimbledon Women's Tennis: Serena Williams beats older sister Venus 7-6, 6-3 for her first Wimbledon singles title

07-06.title: Kansas City Chiefs quarterback Patrick Mahomes agrees
07-06.description: On July 6, 2020, Kansas City Chiefs quarterback Patrick Mahomes agrees to the largest contract for an athlete in sports history, inking a 12-year deal that could end up being worth US$503 million

07-07.title: Wimbledon Women's Tennis: Martina Navratilova wins her
07-07.description: On July 7, 1990, Wimbledon Women's Tennis: Martina Navratilova wins her record ninth Wimbledon singles title, defeating American Zina Garrison 6-4, 6-1

07-08.title: The Boxing Match That Lasted 111 Rounds 1889 John L.
07-08.description: On July 8, 1889, The Boxing Match That Lasted 111 Rounds 1889 John L. Sullivan successfully defends the last officially sanctioned bare-knuckle world heavyweight prizefighting championship when Jake Kilrain's trainer throws in the towel after 75 one-minute rounds near Hattiesburg, Mississippi

07-09.title: $48 Million Prize Money: Anyone For Tennis? 1877 First
07-09.description: On July 9, 1877, $48 Million Prize Money: Anyone For Tennis? 1877 First Wimbledon tennis championship - first official lawn tennis tournament - begins featuring men's singles only

07-10.title: 100th British Open Men's Golf
07-10.description: On July 10, 1971, 100th British Open Men's Golf, Royal Birkdale: Lee Trevino wins the first of his consecutive Open Championships, a stroke ahead of Lu Liang-Huan of Taiwan

07-11.title: Charlotte Cooper beats Hélène Prévost to become the
07-11.description: On July 11, 1900, Charlotte Cooper beats Hélène Prévost to become the first female Olympic tennis champion and the first individual female Olympic champion in any sport

07-12.title: Down With Disco! 1979 " Disco Demolition Night" at
07-12.description: On July 12, 1979, Down With Disco! 1979 " Disco Demolition Night" at Comiskey Park: fans go wild destroying disco records and cause the White Sox to forfeit second game of a doubleheader to the Detroit Tigers

07-12.title: FIFA World Cup Final
07-12.description: On July 12, 1998, FIFA World Cup Final, Stade de France, Saint-Denis: Zinedine Zidane scores twice as France wins first World Cup beating Brazil, 3-0

07-13.title: First football World Cup competition begins in Uruguay
07-13.description: On July 13, 1930, First football World Cup competition begins in Uruguay

07-14.title: 51st Tour de France: Jacques Anquetil of France wins
07-14.description: On July 14, 1964, 51st Tour de France: Jacques Anquetil of France wins 4th consecutive Tour and is first to claim 5 titles

07-15.title: British Open Men's Golf at St Andrews: Jack Nicklaus
07-15.description: On July 15, 1978, British Open Men's Golf at St Andrews: Jack Nicklaus completes his third career Grand Slam, winning by 2 strokes over Ben Crenshaw and Ray Floyd

07-16.title: Wimbledon Men's Tennis: Roger Federer beats Marin
07-16.description: On July 16, 2017, Wimbledon Men's Tennis: Roger Federer beats Marin Čilić 6-3, 6-1, 6-4 for a record 8th Wimbledon men's title

07-17.title: 21st modern Olympic games open in Montreal: 25 African
07-17.description: On July 17, 1976, 21st modern Olympic games open in Montreal: 25 African teams (later rising to 33 nations) boycott the games due to New Zealand playing rugby in apartheid South Africa

07-18.title: Nadia Comăneci (14) becomes the first gymnast in
07-18.description: On July 18, 1976, Nadia Comăneci (14) becomes the first gymnast in Olympic Games history to achieve a perfect 10 score (doing so 7 times) at the Montreal Games

07-19.title: 1st Wimbledon Men's Tennis: 27-year-old English
07-19.description: On July 19, 1877, 1st Wimbledon Men's Tennis: 27-year-old English rackets player Spencer Gore wins inaugural event; beats William Marshall 6-1, 6-2, 6-4

07-19.title: French rider Maurice Garin wins inaugural event
07-19.description: On July 19, 1903, 1st Tour de France: French rider Maurice Garin wins inaugural event

07-20.title: An injured Babe Ruth entertains the touring Australian
07-20.description: On July 20, 1932, An injured Babe Ruth entertains the touring Australian cricketers in his private box at Yankee Stadium as his NY Yankees beat the Chicago White Sox 7-2; 'The Babe' meets 'The Don' ( Don Bradman )

07-20.title: Hank Aaron hits his 755th and last home run off Angels
07-20.description: On July 20, 1976, Hank Aaron hits his 755th and last home run off Angels pitcher Dick Drago

07-21.title: With a record six races remaining
07-21.description: On July 21, 2002, With a record six races remaining, German Ferrari driver Michael Schumacher clinches his fifth F1 World Drivers' Championship with victory in the French Grand Prix at Circuit de Nevers Magny-Cours, his third straight title win

07-22.title: South African golfer Branden Grace records the lowest
07-22.description: On July 22, 2017, South African golfer Branden Grace records the lowest round for a men's major championship with a 62 in the 3rd round at the British Open, Royal Birkdale, England

07-23.title: British Open Men's Golf
07-23.description: On July 23, 2000, British Open Men's Golf, St Andrews: Tiger Woods beats Thomas Bjørn and Ernie Els by eight shots to win his first Open title and becomes the youngest player at only 24 to win all four major titles

07-24.title: 92nd Tour de France: no winner; Lance Armstrong
07-24.description: On July 24, 2005, 92nd Tour de France: no winner; Lance Armstrong retires after winning a record seventh consecutive victory but disqualified in 2012 for doping

07-25.title: 86th Tour de France: Lance Armstrong wins the first of
07-25.description: On July 25, 1999, 86th Tour de France: Lance Armstrong wins the first of seven consecutive Tour de France titles but is later disqualified for doping

07-26.title: Montreal Expos infielder Pete Rose ties Ty Cobb with
07-26.description: On July 26, 1984, Montreal Expos infielder Pete Rose ties Ty Cobb with hit #3,502

07-27.title: American defender Resolute beats Thomas Lipton's
07-27.description: On July 27, 1920, American defender Resolute beats Thomas Lipton's British challenger Shamrock IV 3-2 in the 14th America's Cup

07-28.title: Legendary England cricket all-rounder Ian Botham on
07-28.description: On July 28, 1977, Legendary England cricket all-rounder Ian Botham on debut takes 5 for 74 in the Australian first innings in a seven-wicket third Test win at Trent Bridge

07-29.title: First international world title prizefight: Jack Stack
07-29.description: On July 29, 1751, First international world title prizefight: Jack Stack of England defeats challenger M. Petit of France in 29 minutes in England

07-30.title: Nonpareil Jack Dempsey fights George Fulljames in what
07-30.description: On July 30, 1884, Nonpareil Jack Dempsey fights George Fulljames in what is possibly the first middleweight fight with boxing gloves

07-30.title: Uruguay beats Argentina 4-2 in the inaugural event
07-30.description: On July 30, 1930, First FIFA World Cup Final, Estadio Centenario, Montevideo, Uruguay: Uruguay beats Argentina 4-2 in the inaugural event

07-31.title: Halina Konopacka of Poland hurls a discus world record
07-31.description: On July 31, 1928, Halina Konopacka of Poland hurls a discus world record of 39.62 m to win the first gold medal in women's Olympic athletics at the Amsterdam Games

08-01.title: Earl Engelbert I of Nassau marries Johanna of Poland
08-01.description: On August 1, 1404, Earl Engelbert I of Nassau marries Johanna of Poland

08-01.title: Future Holy Roman Emperor Charles VI (32) marries
08-01.description: On August 1, 1708, Future Holy Roman Emperor Charles VI (32) marries Elisabeth Christine of Brunswick-Wolfenbüttel (16) at the church of Santa María del Mar, Barcelona

08-01.title: Physicist Niels Bohr (26) weds Margrethe Norlund at a
08-01.description: On August 1, 1912, Physicist Niels Bohr (26) weds Margrethe Norlund at a civil ceremony in Slagelse, Denmark

08-02.title: Saratoga Racecourse
08-02.description: On August 2, 1864, Saratoga Racecourse, America's oldest thoroughbred racetrack, opens its inaugural meet with four days of racing

08-03.title: The Greatest 45 Minutes in Sports History 1936
08-03.description: On August 3, 1936, The Greatest 45 Minutes in Sports History 1936 American sprinter Jesse Owens wins the 100 m in 10.3 seconds in front of Adolf Hitler in a famous race at the Berlin Olympics, the first of four gold medals he wins at the Games

08-03.title: Basketball Association of America (BAA) and National
08-03.description: On August 3, 1949, Basketball Association of America (BAA) and National Basketball League (NBL) merge to form the National Basketball Association (NBA), with Maurice Podoloff elected as head of the new league

08-03.title: Brazilian soccer forward Neymar transfers from FC
08-03.description: On August 3, 2017, Brazilian soccer forward Neymar transfers from FC Barcelona to Paris Saint-Germain for a world-record transfer fee of €222 million on a five-year contract

08-04.title: Australian cricket spinner Shane Warne skittles
08-04.description: On August 4, 2001, Australian cricket spinner Shane Warne skittles England (162) with 6/33 to guide tourists to a 7-wicket third Test victory at Trent Bridge; Aussies regain the Ashes with a record seventh straight Test win against England

08-05.title: American athlete Jesse Owens wins the 200 m in a world
08-05.description: On August 5, 1936, American athlete Jesse Owens wins the 200 m in a world record time of 20.7 seconds, his third gold medal of the Berlin Olympics

08-06.title: Dutch super athlete Fanny Blankers-Koen wins the 200 m
08-06.description: On August 6, 1948, Dutch super athlete Fanny Blankers-Koen wins the 200 m in 24.4 seconds at the London Olympics, becoming the first woman to claim three individual track and field gold medals at a Games, having already won the 100 m and 80 m hurdles

08-07.title: NY Yankees slugger Babe Ruth ties MLB record by
08-07.description: On August 7, 1929, NY Yankees slugger Babe Ruth ties MLB record by hitting grand slams in consecutive games for the second time in a 13-1 win against the Philadelphia Athletics

08-08.title: 1st International Lawn Tennis Challenge begins at
08-08.description: On August 8, 1900, 1st International Lawn Tennis Challenge (precursor to Davis Cup) begins at Longwood Cricket Club in Massachusetts, won 3-0 by the US over the British Isles

08-09.title: 1st International Lawn Tennis Challenge
08-09.description: On August 9, 1900, 1st International Lawn Tennis Challenge, Boston, MA: Dwight Davis and Holcombe Ward beat Ernest Black and Herbert Roper Barrett 6-4, 6-4, 6-4 to give the US an unassailable 3-0 lead over the British Isles

08-09.title: Jamaican sprint superstar Usain Bolt wins the 200m at
08-09.description: On August 9, 2012, Jamaican sprint superstar Usain Bolt wins the 200m at the London Olympics in 19.32 seconds, becoming the first to win the 100m and 200m double in consecutive Olympics

08-10.title: Famous Mary Decker-Zola Budd collision during 3000 m
08-10.description: On August 10, 1984, Famous Mary Decker-Zola Budd collision during 3000 m at the Los Angeles Olympics; Decker falls, Budd finishes 7th, and Maricica Puică of Romania wins

08-11.title: New York Yankees slugger Babe Ruth becomes the first
08-11.description: On August 11, 1929, New York Yankees slugger Babe Ruth becomes the first MLB player to hit 500 home runs (off Willis Hudlin) in a 6-5 loss to the Indians at League Park, Cleveland

08-12.title: Mickey Mantle switch-hits a home run for the record
08-12.description: On August 12, 1964, Mickey Mantle switch-hits a home run for the record 10th and final time in a game, with one going 502 feet

08-13.title: American super-swimmer Michael Phelps wins three gold
08-13.description: On August 13, 2008, American super-swimmer Michael Phelps wins three gold medals, all in world record time, in one day at the Beijing Olympics: 200 m IM (1:54.23), 200 m butterfly (1:52.03), and 4x200m freestyle relay (6:58.56)

08-14.title: Indianapolis Motor Speedway in Speedway
08-14.description: On August 14, 1909, Indianapolis Motor Speedway in Speedway, Indiana, home of the Indy 500, hosts its first motorized event, a series of motorcycle races

08-14.title: Oakland's Mark McGwire sets the rookie home run record
08-14.description: On August 14, 1987, Oakland's Mark McGwire sets the rookie home run record at 39 en route to 49

08-15.title: New Zealand's All Blacks play their first rugby test
08-15.description: On August 15, 1903, New Zealand's All Blacks play their first rugby test match against Australia's Wallabies at the Sydney Cricket Ground, the All Blacks win 22-3

08-16.title: Champion of England titleholder Jack Broughton
08-16.description: On August 16, 1743, Champion of England titleholder Jack Broughton publishes "Rules of the Ring," the earliest boxing code

08-16.title: Jamaican sprinter Usain Bolt sets a new world record
08-16.description: On August 16, 2008, Jamaican sprinter Usain Bolt sets a new world record of 9.69 seconds to win the 100 m gold medal at the 2008 Beijing Summer Olympics

08-17.title: MLB player Lou Gehrig plays his record 1
08-17.description: On August 17, 1933, MLB player Lou Gehrig plays his record 1,308th consecutive game

08-18.title: Belarusian weightlifter Andrei Aramnau breaks three
08-18.description: On August 18, 2008, Belarusian weightlifter Andrei Aramnau breaks three world records in the snatch, clean and jerk, and total on his way to winning the men's 105 kg gold medal at the Beijing Olympics

08-19.title: Start of the first and only Olympic cricket match as
08-19.description: On August 19, 1900, Start of the first and only Olympic cricket match as Great Britain defeats France by 158 runs in Paris

08-20.title: American Professional Football Association forms with
08-20.description: On August 20, 1920, American Professional Football Association forms with Jim Thorpe as president and later becomes the National Football League (NFL)

08-20.title: PGA Championship Men's Golf
08-20.description: On August 20, 2000, PGA Championship Men's Golf, Valhalla GC: Tiger Woods wins back-to-back PGA titles after a three-hole playoff with Bob May, becoming the first to win three majors in a calendar year since Ben Hogan in 1953

08-21.title: Ian Botham takes his world-record 356th Test cricket
08-21.description: On August 21, 1986, Ian Botham takes his world-record 356th Test cricket wicket against New Zealand at The Oval

08-22.title: The 100 Guineas Cup yacht race is held around the Isle
08-22.description: On August 22, 1851, The 100 Guineas Cup yacht race is held around the Isle of Wight, the first race of the oldest international sporting competition now known as the America's Cup. In the race, US schooner "America" beats the British cutter "Aurora" by 24 minutes, prompting spectator Queen Victoria to ask who was in second place and the famous reply, "Your majesty, there is no second."

08-23.title: Ethiopian distance runner Kenenisa Bekele wraps up the
08-23.description: On August 23, 2008, Ethiopian distance runner Kenenisa Bekele wraps up the 5,000/10,000m double at the Beijing Olympics when he takes gold in the 5,000m in an Olympic record 12:57.82

08-24.title: Summer Olympics in Beijing become the most-watched
08-24.description: On August 24, 2008, Summer Olympics in Beijing become the most-watched event on TV ever, with nearly 5 billion viewers, 70% of the world's population

08-25.title: Captain Webb Conquers the English Channel 1875 Captain
08-25.description: On August 25, 1875, Captain Webb Conquers the English Channel 1875 Captain Matthew Webb makes the first recorded unassisted swim across the English Channel in 21 hours and 45 minutes

08-25.title: AFL begins placing players' names on the backs of
08-25.description: On August 25, 1960, AFL begins placing players' names on the backs of their jerseys

08-26.title: Bobby Orr signs a five-year contract with the Boston
08-26.description: On August 26, 1971, Bobby Orr signs a five-year contract with the Boston Bruins worth one million dollars, the first million-dollar contract in NHL history

08-27.title: German kayaker Birgit Fischer wins gold in K-4 500 m
08-27.description: On August 27, 2004, German kayaker Birgit Fischer wins gold in K-4 500 m and silver in K-2 500 m in Athens; she is the first woman in any sport to win gold medals at six different Olympics, with golds 24 years apart, and the first person to win two or more medals in five different Games

08-28.title: Soviet gymnast Olga Korbut becomes a media darling at
08-28.description: On August 28, 1972, Soviet gymnast Olga Korbut becomes a media darling at the Munich Olympics, winning gold in the team all-around, followed by two individual golds and a silver

08-29.title: Australia beats England by 7 runs in a match dubbed
08-29.description: On August 29, 1882, Australia beats England by 7 runs in a match dubbed the "Death of English cricket" as Australian fast bowler Fred Spofforth takes 14-90 (7-46 and 7-44)

08-30.title: Detroit Tigers future Baseball Hall of Fame center
08-30.description: On August 30, 1905, Detroit Tigers future Baseball Hall of Fame center fielder Ty Cobb makes his MLB debut, doubling off Jack Chesbro in a 5-3 win over the New York Highlanders at Bennett Park in Detroit

08-31.title: NY Giants set a season record for HRs by a club with
08-31.description: On August 31, 1947, NY Giants set a season record for HRs by a club with 183 and end the season with 221

09-01.title: Bobby Fischer, The World Chess Champ 1972 American
09-01.description: On September 1, 1972, Bobby Fischer, The World Chess Champ 1972 American chess grandmaster Bobby Fischer defeats Russian champion Boris Spassky 12.5-8.5 in Reykjavik, Iceland, in the most publicized world title match ever played; Fischer becomes the first American to win the title

09-01.title: NFL San Francisco 49ers quarterback Colin Kaepernick
09-01.description: On September 1, 2016, NFL San Francisco 49ers quarterback Colin Kaepernick kneels in protest during the US national anthem before pre-season game against the Chargers at San Diego's Qualcomm Stadium, objecting to racial injustice and police brutality in the US

09-02.title: Chicago Cubs slugger Ernie Banks hits his MLB 400th
09-02.description: On September 2, 1965, Chicago Cubs slugger Ernie Banks hits his MLB 400th career HR (off Curt Simmons) in a 5-3 win over St. Louis at Wrigley Field; Simmons also gave up Willie Mays' 400th HR in 1963

09-03.title: Giuseppe "Nino" Farina wins the inaugural Formula 1
09-03.description: On September 3, 1950, Giuseppe "Nino" Farina wins the inaugural Formula 1 World Drivers' Championship by winning the Italian Grand Prix at Monza in an Alfa Romeo, finishing three points ahead of Juan Manuel Fangio

09-04.title: US 4 x 100 m medley relay team of Mike Stamm
09-04.description: On September 4, 1972, US 4 x 100 m medley relay team of Mike Stamm, Tom Bruce, Mark Spitz, and Jerry Heidenreich sets a world record of 3:48.16 to win gold at the Munich Olympics; Mark Spitz becomes the first athlete to win seven Olympic gold medals at a single Games

09-05.title: Eleven Israeli athletes are taken hostage and later
09-05.description: On September 5, 1972, Eleven Israeli athletes are taken hostage and later killed by the Palestinian group Black September at the Munich Olympics

09-06.title: First Test cricket game in England begins with W. G.
09-06.description: On September 6, 1880, First Test cricket game in England begins with W. G. Grace scoring 152 on debut against Australia at The Oval

09-06.title: Red Bull's Max Verstappen sets fastest Formula One lap
09-06.description: On September 6, 2025, Red Bull's Max Verstappen sets fastest Formula One lap in history with 1:18.792, surpassing Lewis Hamilton's record of 1:18.887, at the Italian Grand Prix [1]

09-07.title: A. H. Whiting wins the first automobile race held on a
09-07.description: On September 7, 1896, A. H. Whiting wins the first automobile race held on a closed-circuit track in Cranston, Rhode Island

09-08.title: Kansas City A's Bert Campaneris plays all nine
09-08.description: On September 8, 1965, Kansas City A's Bert Campaneris plays all nine positions in a game

09-09.title: Soviet Union beats the United States 51-50 in the most
09-09.description: On September 9, 1972, Soviet Union beats the United States 51-50 in the most controversial game in international basketball history; with the US leading 50-49, the final 3 seconds are replayed three times until the Soviets finally win

09-10.title: 12:19.8 at the Munich Olympics
09-10.description: On September 10, 1972, American long-distance runner Frank Shorter achieves a famous win in the men's marathon with a time of 2:12:19.8 at the Munich Olympics

09-11.title: Sri Lanka achieves its first Test cricket victory
09-11.description: On September 11, 1985, Sri Lanka achieves its first Test cricket victory, defeating India by 149 runs

09-12.title: Stefan Edberg beats Michael Chang 6-7
09-12.description: On September 12, 1992, Stefan Edberg beats Michael Chang 6-7, 7-5, 7-6, 5-7, 6-4 in 5 hours and 26 minutes, the longest match in US Open history at the time (eclipsed in 2024)

09-13.title: Evian Championship Women's Golf
09-13.description: On September 13, 2015, Evian Championship Women's Golf, Evian Resort GC: Lydia Ko of New Zealand wins by 6 strokes over Lexi Thompson to become the youngest major winner at 18 years and 142 days

09-14.title: Cal Ripken Jr .'s record streak of 8
09-14.description: On September 14, 1987, Cal Ripken Jr .'s record streak of 8,243 consecutive innings (908 games) is finally broken

09-15.title: Maurice Richard announces his retirement. He finishes
09-15.description: On September 15, 1960, Maurice Richard announces his retirement. He finishes his career with 544 goals, an NHL record at the time.

09-16.title: Golf's first recorded hole-in-one is scored by Tom
09-16.description: On September 16, 1869, Golf's first recorded hole-in-one is scored by Tom Morris at Prestwick's 8th hole in Scotland

09-16.title: Los Angeles City Council approves a 300-acre site in
09-16.description: On September 16, 1957, Los Angeles City Council approves a 300-acre site in Chavez Ravine for the Dodgers

09-17.title: Stan Musial makes his major league debut for the St.
09-17.description: On September 17, 1941, Stan Musial makes his major league debut for the St. Louis Cardinals, going 2-for-4

09-18.title: Mickey Mantle Day takes place at Yankee Stadium to
09-18.description: On September 18, 1965, Mickey Mantle Day takes place at Yankee Stadium to honor Mickey Mantle's 2,000th game

09-19.title: Kansas City Royal Alex Gordon hits home run #5
09-19.description: On September 19, 2017, Kansas City Royal Alex Gordon hits home run #5,694, setting a MLB record for the most home runs in a season

09-20.title: Billie Jean King defeats Bobby Riggs in the Battle of
09-20.description: On September 20, 1973, Billie Jean King defeats Bobby Riggs in the Battle of the Sexes tennis match

09-21.title: NFL players begin a 57-day strike
09-21.description: On September 21, 1982, NFL players begin a 57-day strike

09-22.title: Chicago grand jury convenes to investigate charges
09-22.description: On September 22, 1920, Chicago grand jury convenes to investigate charges that eight White Sox players conspired to fix the 1919 World Series

09-23.title: The first baseball team
09-23.description: On September 23, 1845, The first baseball team, the New York Knickerbockers, organizes and adopts a rulebook, known as the Knickerbocker Rules

09-24.title: 2,500 fans witness Babe Ruth 's final New York Yankees
09-24.description: On September 24, 1934, 2,500 fans witness Babe Ruth 's final New York Yankees appearance at Yankee Stadium

09-25.title: Canada defeats the USA by 23 runs in the first
09-25.description: On September 25, 1844, Canada defeats the USA by 23 runs in the first international cricket match at the grounds of St. George's Cricket Club in Manhattan, New York

09-26.title: Australia II wins the America's Cup yacht race
09-26.description: On September 26, 1983, Australia II wins the America's Cup yacht race, becoming the first non-US winner in 132 years

09-27.title: NY Yankee Lou Gehrig hits the first of his 493 home
09-27.description: On September 27, 1923, NY Yankee Lou Gehrig hits the first of his 493 home runs

09-28.title: Homer in the Gloamin'
09-28.description: On September 28, 1938, Homer in the Gloamin', famous walk-off home run hit by Gabby Hartnett of the Chicago Cubs against the Pittsburgh Pirates

09-29.title: NY Giants' Willie Mays makes a famous
09-29.description: On September 29, 1954, NY Giants' Willie Mays makes a famous over-the-shoulder catch of Cleveland Indians' Vic Wertz's 460' drive during Game One of the World Series at the Polo Grounds in NYC

09-30.title: In his final game as a New York Yankee
09-30.description: On September 30, 1934, In his final game as a New York Yankee, Babe Ruth goes 0 for 3

10-01.title: Muhammad Ali stops Joe Frazier in 14 rounds in Quezon
10-01.description: On October 1, 1975, Muhammad Ali stops Joe Frazier in 14 rounds in Quezon City, Philippines, to retain his WBC/WBA heavyweight title in a match billed as the "Thrilla in Manila"

10-02.title: NY Yankees catcher Yogi Berra hits the first pinch-hit
10-02.description: On October 2, 1947, NY Yankees catcher Yogi Berra hits the first pinch-hit home run in World Series history off Ralph Branca in the 7th inning of a 9-8 loss to the Brooklyn Dodgers in Game 3

10-03.title: Flemish painter Peter Paul Rubens weds his first wife
10-03.description: On October 3, 1609, Flemish painter Peter Paul Rubens weds his first wife, Flemish socialite Isabella Brant (17-ish) in St. Michael's Abbey, Antwerp, Spanish Netherlands, until her death in 1626

10-03.title: German composer Fanny Mendelssohn (23) weds German
10-03.description: On October 3, 1829, German composer Fanny Mendelssohn (23) weds German artist Wilhelm Hensel (35), until her death in 1847 [1]

10-03.title: French composer Hector Berlioz (29) weds Irish actress
10-03.description: On October 3, 1833, French composer Hector Berlioz (29) weds Irish actress Harriet Smithson (30) at the British Embassy in Paris, France

10-04.title: 1st US Open Men's Golf
10-04.description: On October 4, 1895, 1st US Open Men's Golf, Newport GC: Englishman Horace Rawlins wins the inaugural event, beating Willie Dunn of Scotland by 2 strokes

10-05.title: NY Yankees and NY Giants play out a controversial 3-3
10-05.description: On October 5, 1922, NY Yankees and NY Giants play out a controversial 3-3 tie in 10 innings in Game 2 of Baseball World Series at Polo Grounds, Manhattan, NYC; Giants win series 4-0-1

10-06.title: First World Series Baseball Game 1: Cincinnati Red
10-06.description: On October 6, 1882, First World Series Baseball Game 1: Cincinnati Red Stockings (AA) beat Chicago White Stockings (NL) 4-0 at Bank Street Grounds, Cincinnati

10-06.title: American Simone Biles wins all-around gold at the
10-06.description: On October 6, 2023, American Simone Biles wins all-around gold at the World Championships in Antwerp, Belgium, becoming the most decorated gymnast with 34 World and Olympic medals [1]

10-07.title: The last competitive soccer match at Wembley Stadium
10-07.description: On October 7, 2000, The last competitive soccer match at Wembley Stadium sees England defeated 1-0 by Germany, with the only goal scored by Liverpool's Dietmar Hamann. The match is Tony Adams' 60th at Wembley, setting the record for most appearances at the stadium

10-08.title: Padded gloves designed by Jack Broughton are first
10-08.description: On October 8, 1818, Padded gloves designed by Jack Broughton are first used in a competitive boxing match between two unnamed English boxers at Aix-la-Chapelle in France

10-09.title: Cincinnati Reds beat Chicago White Sox 10-5 at
10-09.description: On October 9, 1919, Cincinnati Reds beat Chicago White Sox 10-5 at Comiskey Park for a 5-3 series victory; due to the 'Black Sox Scandal', it is the last World Series to take place without a Commissioner of Baseball

10-09.title: Baseball World Series: NY Yankees beat St. Louis
10-09.description: On October 9, 1928, Baseball World Series: NY Yankees beat St. Louis Cardinals 7-3 at Sportsman's Park to become the first team to sweep consecutive World Series; Babe Ruth hits 3 home runs for the Yankees

10-10.title: African American inventor Isaac R. Johnson patents the
10-10.description: On October 10, 1899, African American inventor Isaac R. Johnson patents the bicycle frame

10-11.title: South African Cricket Board issues former captain
10-11.description: On October 11, 2000, South African Cricket Board issues former captain Hansie Cronje a life ban due to match-fixing allegations

10-12.title: IXX Summer Olympic Games open at Mexico City
10-12.description: On October 12, 1968, IXX Summer Olympic Games open at Mexico City, Mexico; first Olympics in Latin America

10-13.title: 1st Baseball World Series: Boston Americans beat
10-13.description: On October 13, 1903, 1st Baseball World Series: Boston Americans beat Pittsburgh Pirates, 3-0 in Game 8 at Huntington Avenue for a 5-3 series victory

10-13.title: Simone Biles becomes the most decorated gymnast in
10-13.description: On October 13, 2019, Simone Biles becomes the most decorated gymnast in history when she wins her record 25th medal at the World Championships in Stuttgart, Germany

10-14.title: German writer, artist and politician Johann Wolfgang
10-14.description: On October 14, 1806, German writer, artist and politician Johann Wolfgang von Goethe marries mistress Christiane Vulpius in Weimar

10-14.title: Athlete Jim Thorpe (25) weds Margaret Iva Miller at
10-14.description: On October 14, 1913, Athlete Jim Thorpe (25) weds Margaret Iva Miller at St. Patrick's Catholic Church in Carlisle, Pennsylvania

10-14.title: German "All Quiet on the Western Front" author Erich
10-14.description: On October 14, 1923, German "All Quiet on the Western Front" author Erich Maria Remarque (25) weds German actress Ilse Jutta Zambona; divorce in 1930, remarry in 1938, re-divorce in 1957

10-15.title: Wayne Gretzky surpasses Gordie Howe as the NHL's
10-15.description: On October 15, 1989, Wayne Gretzky surpasses Gordie Howe as the NHL's all-time top scorer

10-16.title: Black Power Salute 1968 Americans Tommie Smith (gold
10-16.description: On October 16, 1968, Black Power Salute 1968 Americans Tommie Smith (gold, 19.83, WR) and John Carlos (bronze) famously give the Black Power salute on the 200 m medal podium during the Mexico City Olympics to protest racism and injustice against African Americans

10-17.title: 1st British Open Men's Golf
10-17.description: On October 17, 1860, 1st British Open Men's Golf, Prestwick GC: Willie Park Sr. wins the inaugural event by two strokes over fellow Scot Tom Morris Sr.

10-18.title: Black Power Salute 1968 US Olympic Committee suspends
10-18.description: On October 18, 1968, Black Power Salute 1968 US Olympic Committee suspends Tommie Smith and John Carlos for giving the Black Power salute to protest racism and injustice against African-Americans during Olympic medal ceremony

10-19.title: Montreal Canadien Maurice "Rocket" Richard becomes the
10-19.description: On October 19, 1957, Montreal Canadien Maurice "Rocket" Richard becomes the first NHL player to score 500 goals

10-20.title: US President Nixon proclaims Jim Thorpe to have been
10-20.description: On October 20, 1973, US President Nixon proclaims Jim Thorpe to have been the greatest athlete of the first half of the 20th century

10-21.title: Phillies win their first World Championship in their
10-21.description: On October 21, 1980, Phillies win their first World Championship in their 98-year history

10-22.title: New York City Marathon: Grete Waitz of Norway wins in
10-22.description: On October 22, 1978, New York City Marathon: Grete Waitz of Norway wins in her race debut with a world record time of 2:32:30; Bill Rodgers wins his third straight title in 2:12:12

10-23.title: Australian Jack Brabham is the first to win the F1
10-23.description: On October 23, 1966, Australian Jack Brabham is the first to win the F1 World Drivers' Championship and the International Cup for Constructors' Championship in the same year, finishing 2nd in the season-ending Mexican Grand Prix at Autódromo Hermanos Rodríguez

10-24.title: Recognized by FIFA as the oldest existing club still
10-24.description: On October 24, 1857, Recognized by FIFA as the oldest existing club still playing football in the world, Sheffield FC is founded in Yorkshire, England, and is now based in Dronfield, Derbyshire

10-25.title: 1st "World Championship" Baseball Series
10-25.description: On October 25, 1884, 1st "World Championship" Baseball Series, Polo Grounds, NYC: Providence Grays (NL) beat NY Mets (American Association) 12-2 in 6 innings for a 3-game sweep; game abandoned because of bitter cold

10-26.title: Football Association forms in England
10-26.description: On October 26, 1863, Football Association forms in England, standardizing soccer and splitting from rugby

10-27.title: Tiger Woods scores a wire-to-wire 3-stroke win over
10-27.description: On October 27, 2019, Tiger Woods scores a wire-to-wire 3-stroke win over Hideki Matsuyama at the inaugural Zozo Championship at Accordia Golf & Country Club, tying Sam Snead 's record of 82 PGA victories

10-28.title: II Summer (Modern) Olympic Games in Paris end after
10-28.description: On October 28, 1900, II Summer (Modern) Olympic Games in Paris end after five months; no opening or closing ceremonies are held

10-29.title: Cassius Clay [ Muhammad Ali ]
10-29.description: On October 29, 1960, Cassius Clay [ Muhammad Ali ], in his first professional fight, beats Tunney Hunsaker on points in 6 rounds in Louisville, Kentucky

10-30.title: Muhammad Ali KOs George Foreman in the 8th round in
10-30.description: On October 30, 1974, Muhammad Ali KOs George Foreman in the 8th round in "The Rumble in the Jungle" in Kinshasa, Zaire, regaining the world heavyweight boxing title using the famous "rope-a-dope" tactic

10-31.title: American jockey Chris Antley becomes the first rider
10-31.description: On October 31, 1987, American jockey Chris Antley becomes the first rider to win nine races in a day (four at Aqueduct and five at Meadowlands)

11-01.title: Celtics forward Chuck Cooper becomes the first African
11-01.description: On November 1, 1950, Celtics forward Chuck Cooper becomes the first African American to play in the NBA during Boston's 107-84 loss to the Fort Wayne Pistons; future Hall of Famer Bob Cousy also debuts for the Celtics

11-02.title: First Official Cheerleader 1898 Cheerleading begins in
11-02.description: On November 2, 1898, First Official Cheerleader 1898 Cheerleading begins in the United States as Johnny Campbell leads the crowd cheering on the football team at the University of Minnesota

11-02.title: Baseball World Series: Chicago Cubs beat Cleveland
11-02.description: On November 2, 2016, Baseball World Series: Chicago Cubs beat Cleveland Indians, 8-7 in Game 7 at Progressive Field, Cleveland; first Cubs' title in 108 years; MVP: Chicago utility Ben Zobrist

11-03.title: Ayrton Senna wins the Australian Grand Prix in Adelaide
11-03.description: On November 3, 1991, Ayrton Senna wins the Australian Grand Prix in Adelaide, the shortest F1 race ever run (14 laps) due to wet conditions; Senna secures his 3rd World Drivers' Championship by 24 points over Nigel Mansell

11-04.title: Charlotte and Miami for 1988
11-04.description: On November 4, 1987, NBA announces four new franchises: Charlotte and Miami for 1988, and Minneapolis and Orlando for 1989

11-05.title: American chess grandmaster Bobby Fischer defeats
11-05.description: On November 5, 1992, American chess grandmaster Bobby Fischer defeats Russian Boris Spassky in an unofficial match in Belgrade dubbed the "Revenge Match of the 20th Century"

11-06.title: US government issues a stamp to honor the 100th
11-06.description: On November 6, 1961, US government issues a stamp to honor the 100th birthday of James Naismith, the Canadian-born inventor of basketball

11-07.title: Magic Johnson announces he has HIV and retires from
11-07.description: On November 7, 1991, Magic Johnson announces he has HIV and retires from the LA Lakers

11-08.title: Brazilian surfer Rodrigo Koxa breaks the world record
11-08.description: On November 8, 2017, Brazilian surfer Rodrigo Koxa breaks the world record for surfing the largest wave ever at 24.38 meters in Nazaré, Portugal

11-09.title: Garry Kasparov Becomes World Chess Champion 1985
11-09.description: On November 9, 1985, Garry Kasparov Becomes World Chess Champion 1985 Russia's Garry Kasparov, at 22, becomes the youngest World Chess Champion with a 13-11 win over fellow countryman Anatoly Karpov

11-10.title: Belgium crown prince Leopold weds princess Astrid
11-10.description: On November 10, 1926, Belgium crown prince Leopold weds princess Astrid Bernadotte of Sweden

11-10.title: Actress Doris Roberts (33) weds novelist William Goyen
11-10.description: On November 10, 1963, Actress Doris Roberts (33) weds novelist William Goyen (48)

11-10.title: Netherlands 2nd Chamber accept marriage of Princess
11-10.description: On November 10, 1965, Netherlands 2nd Chamber accept marriage of Princess Beatrice & Claus von Amsberg

11-11.title: New York Knicks play their first Basketball
11-11.description: On November 11, 1946, New York Knicks play their first Basketball Association of America (BAA) home game at Madison Square Garden, losing 78-68 to the Chicago Stags in overtime

11-12.title: Zaheer Abbas scores his 100th first-class century
11-12.description: On November 12, 1982, Zaheer Abbas scores his 100th first-class century while playing a Test for Pakistan against India and goes on to score 215 runs

11-13.title: WBA lightweight champion Ray Mancini defeats South
11-13.description: On November 13, 1982, WBA lightweight champion Ray Mancini defeats South Korean challenger Duk Koo Kim by TKO in the 14th round in Las Vegas; Kim collapses, falls into a coma, and dies four days later; as a result, WBC shortens title bouts to 12 rounds; WBA and WBO follow in 1988, and IBF in 1989

11-14.title: Don Shula becomes the coach with the most wins in NFL
11-14.description: On November 14, 1993, Don Shula becomes the coach with the most wins in NFL history

11-15.title: Mickey Wright shoots a 62
11-15.description: On November 15, 1964, Mickey Wright shoots a 62, the lowest golf score for a female professional at the Tall City Open in Midland, Texas

11-15.title: British Mercedes driver Lewis Hamilton clinches his
11-15.description: On November 15, 2020, British Mercedes driver Lewis Hamilton clinches his fourth consecutive and record-equalling seventh F1 World Drivers' Championship by winning the Turkish GP at Intercity Istanbul Park, Tuzla

11-16.title: 16-year-old Lionel Messi makes his official debut for
11-16.description: On November 16, 2003, 16-year-old Lionel Messi makes his official debut for FC Barcelona when he comes on as a substitute in a friendly against Porto

11-17.title: German Red Bull driver Sebastian Vettel wins a record
11-17.description: On November 17, 2013, German Red Bull driver Sebastian Vettel wins a record 8th consecutive Formula 1 race with victory in the US Grand Prix at the Circuit of the Americas

11-18.title: 1st Solheim Cup Women's Golf
11-18.description: On November 18, 1990, 1st Solheim Cup Women's Golf, Lake Nona G & CC: US beats Europe 11½-4½ in the inaugural event; Kathy Whitworth and Mickey Walker are the US and European captains

11-19.title: US Supreme Court rules (7-2) that baseball is a sport
11-19.description: On November 19, 1953, US Supreme Court rules (7-2) that baseball is a sport, not a business

11-20.title: Geo Lefevre and Henri Desgrange create the Tour de
11-20.description: On November 20, 1902, Geo Lefevre and Henri Desgrange create the Tour de France bicycle race

11-21.title: First match ever played in the Australian National
11-21.description: On November 21, 1905, First match ever played in the Australian National Tennis Championships

11-22.title: Arthur Knight patents steel-shafted golf clubs
11-22.description: On November 22, 1910, Arthur Knight patents steel-shafted golf clubs

11-23.title: 1st US Olympic Games 1904 III Summer Olympic Games
11-23.description: On November 23, 1904, 1st US Olympic Games 1904 III Summer Olympic Games close at Washington University in St. Louis Francis Olympic Field

11-24.title: Sachin Tendulkar scores a Test cricket fifty at the
11-24.description: On November 24, 1989, Sachin Tendulkar scores a Test cricket fifty at the record young age of 16 years and 214 days

11-25.title: Pierre de Coubertin first publicly proposes the
11-25.description: On November 25, 1892, Pierre de Coubertin first publicly proposes the revival of the Olympic Games during a speech at the Sorbonne in Paris, celebrating the fifth anniversary of the French athletics union [1]

11-25.title: Pat Summerall and John Madden broadcast a game
11-25.description: On November 25, 1979, Pat Summerall and John Madden broadcast a game together for the first time, a pairing that lasts 22 years and becomes one of the most well-known partnerships in TV sports broadcasting history

11-26.title: NHL forms with the Montreal Canadiens
11-26.description: On November 26, 1917, NHL forms with the Montreal Canadiens, Montreal Wanderers, Ottawa Senators, Quebec Bulldogs, and a new Toronto franchise (later the Arenas) as the National Hockey Association disbands

11-27.title: Gordie Howe becomes the first to play in 1
11-27.description: On November 27, 1961, Gordie Howe becomes the first to play in 1,000 NHL games

11-28.title: 1st Car Race in America 1895 America's first auto race
11-28.description: On November 28, 1895, 1st Car Race in America 1895 America's first auto race is organized by the "Chicago Times-Herald" from Chicago to Evanston and back; six cars participate in the 55-mile race, and Frank Duryea wins, averaging 7 mph

11-29.title: Joe Montana of the San Francisco 49ers completes an
11-29.description: On November 29, 1987, Joe Montana of the San Francisco 49ers completes an NFL record of 22 consecutive passes

11-30.title: First international soccer game
11-30.description: On November 30, 1872, First international soccer game, Scotland draws with England (0-0) in Glasgow

12-01.title: Jack Nicklaus finishes at 13-under-par 275 to win the
12-01.description: On December 1, 1973, Jack Nicklaus finishes at 13-under-par 275 to win the Walt Disney World Open by one stroke over Mason Rudolph and becomes the first player to reach $2 million in PGA Tour career earnings

12-02.title: Association of Football Players' and Trainers' Union
12-02.description: On December 2, 1907, Association of Football Players' and Trainers' Union (English Professional Football Players' Association) is formed by Charlie Roberts and Billy Meredith in Manchester, England

12-03.title: Dutchman Anton Geesink becomes the first non-Japanese
