12-03.description: On December 3, 1961, Dutchman Anton Geesink becomes the first non-Japanese judo world champion

12-04.title: MLB Commissioner Kenesaw Mountain Landis announces
12-04.description: On December 4, 1943, MLB Commissioner Kenesaw Mountain Landis announces that any baseball club may sign Negro players

12-05.title: Russia is banned from the next Winter Olympics in
12-05.description: On December 5, 2017, Russia is banned from the next Winter Olympics in South Korea for state-sponsored doping

12-06.title: San Francisco 49ers wide receiver Jerry Rice catches
12-06.description: On December 6, 1992, San Francisco 49ers wide receiver Jerry Rice catches NFL record 101st touchdown in a 27-3 win over the Miami Dolphins at Candlestick Park

12-07.title: Ballon d'Or: Real Madrid forward Cristiano Ronaldo
12-07.description: On December 7, 2017, Ballon d'Or: Real Madrid forward Cristiano Ronaldo wins his fifth and second consecutive award, equaling Lionel Messi's record

12-08.title: Commencement of the first day/night World Series
12-08.description: On December 8, 1978, Commencement of the first day/night World Series Cricket Supertest at VFL Park, Melbourne

12-09.title: Chicago Hustle vs. Milwaukee Does
12-09.description: On December 9, 1978, First game of the Women's Professional Basketball League (WBL): Chicago Hustle vs. Milwaukee Does

12-10.title: "Spirit of the Times
12-10.description: On December 10, 1831, "Spirit of the Times," the premier sports journal of the 19th century, begins publishing in New York City

12-11.title: Joe DiMaggio announces his retirement from baseball
12-11.description: On December 11, 1951, Joe DiMaggio announces his retirement from baseball

12-12.title: Baseball Rules Committee greatly revises the rule
12-12.description: On December 12, 1930, Baseball Rules Committee greatly revises the rule book; a ball that bounces into the stands is now a ground-rule double instead of a home run

12-13.title: The Mitchell Report is publicly released listing the
12-13.description: On December 13, 2007, The Mitchell Report is publicly released listing the names of 89 Major League Baseball players that have presumably used anabolic steroids and human growth hormones. Notable players named include Roger Clemens and Miguel Tejada.

12-14.title: Bill France organizes the first meeting of influential
12-14.description: On December 14, 1947, Bill France organizes the first meeting of influential racers and promoters in Daytona Beach, Florida, which leads to the formation of the National Association for Stock Car Auto Racing (NASCAR)

12-15.title: Arthur Ashe is named Sports Illustrated Sportsperson
12-15.description: On December 15, 1992, Arthur Ashe is named Sports Illustrated Sportsperson of the Year

12-16.title: Golfer Bobby Jones is the first to win the James E.
12-16.description: On December 16, 1930, Golfer Bobby Jones is the first to win the James E. Sullivan Award for the best US amateur athlete

12-17.title: Australian cricket prodigy Don Bradman scores 118 in
12-17.description: On December 17, 1927, Australian cricket prodigy Don Bradman scores 118 in his first class debut for New South Wales against South Australia at Adelaide Oval

12-18.title: For second consecutive year
12-18.description: On December 18, 1961, For second consecutive year, AP names Wilma Rudolph female athlete of year

12-18.title: FIFA World Cup Final
12-18.description: On December 18, 2022, FIFA World Cup Final, Lusail Stadium, Qatar: Argentina beats France, 4-2 in penalty shootout after teams locked at 3-3 after extra time; Lionel Messi scores 2 for Argentina, Kylian Mbappé a hat-trick for France

12-19.title: "Miracle at the New Meadowlands"
12-19.description: On December 19, 2010, "Miracle at the New Meadowlands", the Philadelphia Eagles trail the NY Giants by 21 points with eight minutes to play before scoring four touchdowns in the final seven minutes, including a dramatic walk-off punt return for a touchdown by DeSean Jackson

12-20.title: England beat Australia by 10 runs in the first six-day
12-20.description: On December 20, 1894, England beat Australia by 10 runs in the first six-day cricket Test, Australia needed 177 to win but were all out for 166

12-21.title: First game of basketball
12-21.description: On December 21, 1891, First game of basketball, based on rules created by James Naismith, is played by 18 students in Springfield, Massachusetts, celebrated today as World Basketball Day

12-22.title: Amateur Golf Association of the United States is
12-22.description: On December 22, 1894, Amateur Golf Association of the United States is formed in New York City, renamed soon afterwards to the United States Golf Association

12-24.title: Daniel Stover and William Hance patent a bicycle with
12-24.description: On December 24, 1889, Daniel Stover and William Hance patent a bicycle with a backpedal brake

12-24.title: Chaminade, with a student body of only 850 students,
12-24.description: On December 24, 1982, Chaminade, with a student body of only 850 students, defeats #1 ranked Virginia 77-72 in a Honolulu holiday basketball classic

12-25.title: 40,000 people watch Union Army soldiers play baseball
12-25.description: On December 25, 1862, 40,000 people watch Union Army soldiers play baseball at Hilton Head, South Carolina

12-26.title: First ever inter-club football match takes place at
12-26.description: On December 26, 1860, First ever inter-club football match takes place at Sandygate Road in Sheffield, England, between Sheffield F.C. and Hallam F.C. who win 2-0

12-27.title: Edmonton Oiler Wayne Gretzky becomes the fastest NHL
12-27.description: On December 27, 1981, Edmonton Oiler Wayne Gretzky becomes the fastest NHL player to reach 100 points in a season (his 38th game), scoring 4 goals and an assist in a 10-3 win over the visiting Los Angeles Kings

12-28.title: "The Greatest Game Ever Played": Baltimore Colts win
12-28.description: On December 28, 1958, "The Greatest Game Ever Played": Baltimore Colts win the 26th NFL Championship against the NY Giants 23-17 at Yankee Stadium in the first sudden-death overtime game in NFL history, with 17 future members of the Pro Football Hall of Fame involved

12-28.title: Detroit Lions crash to a 31-21 loss to the Green Bay
12-28.description: On December 28, 2008, Detroit Lions crash to a 31-21 loss to the Green Bay Packers at Lambeau Field, the first team in NFL history to go winless in a 16-game season

12-29.title: Wayne Gretzky and Martina Navratilova are named
12-29.description: On December 29, 1989, Wayne Gretzky and Martina Navratilova are named Athletes of the Decade by the Associated Press

12-29.title: Australian cricket spin king Shane Warne dismisses
12-29.description: On December 29, 1994, Australian cricket spin king Shane Warne dismisses England's Phil DeFreitas, Darren Gough and Devon Malcolm for a famous hat-trick in the second Test win in Melbourne

12-30.title: Donald Bradman scores 267 for South Australia against
12-30.description: On December 30, 1939, Donald Bradman scores 267 for South Australia against Victoria, a world record 34th first-class double century

12-31.title: The 1988 Fog Bowl 1988 A heavy
12-31.description: On December 31, 1988, The 1988 Fog Bowl 1988 A heavy, dense fog rolls over Soldier Field in Chicago during the second quarter of the Bears vs. Eagles NFC Divisional Playoff game, cutting visibility to 15 to 20 yards in a game known as " The Fog Bowl " (Bears win 20-12)

12-31.title: Jockey Kent Desormeaux sets a record with 598 wins in
12-31.description: On December 31, 1989, Jockey Kent Desormeaux sets a record with 598 wins in a single year
